page.title: 06The Haltwhistle-Alston Line.
page.content: The third railway line used to go to Alston - the highest market town in England. It was a single track line. The diesel train went to Alston. Then the driver got in the other end and drove back to Haltwhistle. The line was closed down on May 1st 1976 because it was getting old. The {Lambley Viaduct}was becoming unsafe. British Rail pulled up all the tracks. They built a new all-weather road to Alston. There is an United bus service from Haltwhistle to Alston. It costs{75p}to travel to Lambley from Haltwhistle and it costs{Â£1.15}to travel to Alston. In a bad winter the road gets blocked with snow. The railway never got blocked as much as the road. My Dad and everybody else likes the railway better than the road.
